result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appeared in court to clear the bench warrant issued on 9-20-2022.  Arguments heard as to bail.  $5000 signature bond remains.  Court reinstated JusticePoint supervision and ordered the defendant to report to JusticePoint FORTHWITH.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 9-28-22

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz not in court.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call.  Defense counsel is in trial on another matter in Branch 46.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz not in court.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court for Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defendant does not appear.  Court set a calendar call date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Calendar call scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Melissa Marie Mazurkiewicz not in court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
